segments.text: Why did he invite her here?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, God, line.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why does that bother you?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why does- why, does that bother you?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She's been in New York three and a half years.  Why, all of a sudden--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, maybe- maybe he just wanted to see her.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Nobody comes seven hundred miles just to see.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What do you mean?  He grew up next door to the girl all his life.  Why shouldn't he want to -- why shouldn't he want to see her again?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't look at me like that.  He didn't tell me anymore than he told you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: He's not going to marry her.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How do you know he's even thinking about it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's got that about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well so what?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What's going on here, Joe?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Line.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Now listen, kid. Now, listen.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh.  Now listen, kid.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She's not his girl, Joe.  She knows she's not.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can't read her mind.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Then why is she still single?  New York is full of men.  Why hasn't she married?  Probably a hundred people told her she's foolish, but she's waited.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How do you know why she waited?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Because she knows what I know, that's why.  She's faithful as a rock.  In my worst moments, I think of her waiting and I know, again, that I'm right.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Look, it's a nice day.  What are we arguing for?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Nobody in this house dares take her faith away, Joe.  Strangers might, but not his father, not his brother.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What do you want me to do? What do you want?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I want you to act like he's coming back, both of you.  Don't think I haven't noticed you since he invited her here.  I won't stand for any nonsense.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: But, Kate--
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Because if he's not coming back, I'll kill myself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Laugh.  Laugh at me.  But why did that happen the very night that she came here?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: She goes to sleep in his bed and his memorial breaks in pieces.  Look.  Look at it.  Joe--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Believe with me, Joe.  I can't stand all alone
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Only last week, a man turned up in Detroit missing longer than Larry.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Alright, alright.  Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You, above all, have got to believe.  You.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why me above all?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just don't stop believing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What does that mean, me above all?  Look at you.  You're shaking.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I can't help it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What have I got to hide?  What the hell is the matter with you, Kate?
segments.speaker: M
